description: MassMutual India is here to empower careers and help people secure their futures through innovation and technology.

tagline: Empowering careers and helping people secure their futures through innovation and technology.

updates.text: Week on week, we are proud to welcome new members to our ever-growing #MassMutualIndia family. If you are interested in joining us, then check out the open positions with us here http://spr.ly/60489iNlk

Week on week, we are proud to welcome new members to our ever-growing #MassMutualIndia family. If you are interested in joining us, then check out the open positions with us here http://spr.ly/60489iNlk

The roundtable conducted by The Economic Times focused on 'Driving Workplace Collaboration'. Industry leaders, heads of the organizations shared their experiences of collaboration and how technology is playing a role to accelerate it. 

Kartik Ayalh, Director, Technology Delivery shared how at #MassMutualIndia we prepared the workforce to tackle the remote work situation. From the times when the remote work started to hybrid work model now, we have evolved with the needs of the time. Collaboration, as Kartik emphasized, roots from a very important value - Trust. He also mentioned that technology has helped strengthen the trust and create a transparent work culture that we currently have. http://spr.ly/6048Spt78

'Building Resilient Teams for Tomorrow' was the theme this year for the Leadership Retreat 2024. This one day retreat is the time for all people managers and leaders to come together to discuss achievements, strategy, future plans and loads of learning on leadership. Ravi Tangirala, Head of MassMutual India set the tone for the day by sharing our successes, areas of improvement and on strengthening our capabilities as innovation partner of the parent organization.

This year we had the fortune to listen to Dr. Chinnababu Sunkavalli, a renowned Robotic Surgical Oncologist. He shared many life lessons which actually struck a chord and resonated with the leaders in the room. He, through his work embodies values like trust, honesty and the need to constantly evolve. These were some lessons in leadership he left us with, to take back. The session also had team building activities with undertones of building resilient teams. As the day progressed, we also had Jodi Dudley, Head of Global Business Services talk to us virtually on the strategies for building up the GBS to the next level. 

The lessons from each of the leaders, we are sure will pave the path and help us lead this digital transformation of business.

How can organizations make meaningful contributions in shaping the talent of tomorrow formed the crux of the roundtable discussion held by The Economic Times.

Rachna Taranath, Interim Head of HR #MassMutualIndia very aptly underlined the efforts made by the organization to make the future ready talent meet the niche requirements. She also emphasized on importance of symbiotic relationship between the academia and industry to see the young talent evolve and shape the next industrial revolution. https://lnkd.in/g_SUpT5D
We like to share stories of our employees that inspire. Meet Mahesh, who shares how #MassMutualIndia has helped him grow from an intern and a full time employee now. http://spr.ly/6043ivLZT
